meanings.definition: An ambush or trap set for an enemy.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers set up an ambuscade to surprise the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The hunters carefully planned the ambuscade to catch the wild animals.
meanings.sent3: The cunning fox avoided the ambuscade set by the hunters.
meanings.sent4: The ambuscade laid by the pirates was as silent as the night.
meanings.sent5: The ambuscade in the forest was like a hidden spider waiting for its prey.

meanings.definition: To lie in wait for an enemy or prey.
meanings.sent1: The lion will ambuscade near the watering hole to catch its prey.
meanings.sent2: The hunters decided to ambuscade behind the bushes for a better chance at success.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to ambuscade the toy mouse but failed hilariously.
meanings.sent4: The spy would ambuscade in the shadows, waiting for the right moment to strike.
meanings.sent5: The ambush predator would ambuscade with lightning speed, surprising its target.
